Comment: Maybe TL;DR, but hopefully not...  Interesting 100 days. For those out there who might be math curious, I did a linear regression analysis relating tRump's *Net Approval Rating* to the number of days he'd been in office - using a downloaded set of [Nate Silver's always well curated ratings](https://www.natesilver.net/p/trump-approval-ratings-nate-silver-bulletin), based on polling averages he's maintained independently  since his time at 538. The *Net Approval Rating* is probably best described as **the percent who approve** **- the percent who disapprove**.  I found a rather stunning correlation of 0.94 (R^(2) = 0.94 - a measure of how closely the predictions of  the resulting ***regression equation*** match the actual data) out of the maximum possible 1.00 - which would indicate essentially a perfect fit of all the points analyzed to the resulting equation. Here is the equation which resulted:  Predicted Net Approval = 7.41% - (0.15% x Trump Days in Office, including golf days)  So, for example, on day 37 (arbitrarily chosen by me) the regression prediction of tRump's approval that day would be  >7.41 - (0.15 x 37) = 7.41 - 5.55 = 1.86% (predicted net positive approval)   The actual approval on day 37 was 0.85%   >For day 65,   7.41 -(0.15 x 65) = -2.34% (predicted net disapproval)   Actual approval on day 65 was -1.72%  >And, for day 99 (the last posted as of this morning),   7.41 -(0.15 x 100) = -7.44% (predicted net disapproval)   Actual approval on day 99 (yesterday) - 9.66%  Just for giggles, I wanted to see what tRump's approval would be at 200 days into his benevolent despotism... since the regression seems to pretty well reflect the actual approval numbers - at least within a percent or two.  >741 - (0.15 \* 200) = -22.6% (predicted net disapproval)  This seeming hopeful analysis presumes that the growing disapprovals of the odious regime will not get even worse for OrangeMan than the trend so far... so if you take any bets at all, you'd best up the point spread on the lower end.
